title: Qatari companies partner with Iraq on $9.5bn worth of projects
description: Projects include the construction of power plants that will reduce Iraq's reliance on Iran for its energy needs.

title: Russia and Ukraine suffer heavy losses as front-line battles rage
description: Ukraine's counteroffensive continues with small advances as Russia conducts 'effective' defensive operations.

title: Tunisia protesters demand release of ‘political prisoners’
description: Some 300 demonstrators in Tunis demanded freedom for former ministers, businessmen and other opposition members.

title: Can China and the US mend their troubled relations?
description: The United States' top diplomat flew to Beijing aiming to ease months of tension.

title: Israel to ramp up settlement expansion in occupied West Bank
description: The finance minister was granted sweeping powers to expedite construction, bypassing measures in place for 27 years.

title: My imprisoned father is the freest man I know
description: My father was detained in the crackdown on dissent in Tunisia. He could have fled but chose to stand up to dictatorship.

title: Pakistan arrests suspected traffickers after refugee boat tragedy
description: Authorities vowed the 10 suspected human traffickers they arrested would be 'severely punished'.

title: Grieving families mourn for Uganda school attack victims
description: At least 41 people, mostly students, killed in suspect rebel attack at a school in a town close to DRC border.

title: Uganda school attack: What we know so far
description: Uganda reels from its worse attack in more than 10 years after a rebel group killed 41 civilians, mostly students.

title: In Gabes, Tunisia’s artisanal fishers are watching fish die
description: Between encroachments by big trawlers, lethal pollution levels and a cost-of-living crisis, life is harder than ever.

title: Why are the US and Iran holding talks and why does it matter?
description: A deal could see Iran free US prisoners in return for the release of billions of dollars worth of Iranian assets.

title: Why is the Turkish lira’s value still falling?
description: Experts say the 'suppressed' lira is reaching its true value as they forecast a continued fall against the dollar.

title: Mali’s military rulers hold constitutional referendum vote
description: The military gov't promises a return to civilian rule, but opponents argue changes would give president excessive power.

title: Yemenis embark on first direct flight to Saudi Arabia since 2016
description: The flight carried Yemeni Muslims heading to Hajj and signals easing tensions between the two countries.

title: Tunisia bars TV, radio reports of opposition conspiracy cases
description: The cases banned from being covered involve at least 21 dissidents under investigation on accusations of ‘conspiracy'.

title: Biden holds first campaign rally for 2024 re-election bid
description: Biden addresses members of the AFL-CIO, which represents more than 12.5 million workers, as he kicks off campaign rally.

title: Philippine ferry with 120 people on board catches fire at sea
description: Rescue under way after M/V Esperanza Star catches fires while travelling from Siquijor province to Bohol province.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 480
description: as the war enters its 480th day, these are the main developments.

title: US’s Blinken lands in China but hopes for breakthrough low
description: US's top diplomat aiming to keep lines of communication open amid heightened tensions between two countries.
